pr_title: CDPCP-1561. Allow internal actor to call user sync endpoint

timeline.bodyText: you should also allow setting the account id to your own account
timeline.author: handavid
handavid

timeline.message:
CDPCP-1561. Allow internal actor to call user sync endpoint

Previously the accountId to sync was inferred from the calling
user, which doesn't work when the calling user is the internal
actor. This is fixed by including accountId as an optional
parameter to the user sync request.

timeline.bodyText: do we really want to propagate that information to customers if somehow they can invoke it with different accountid?
timeline.author: lacikaaa

replies.bodyText:
I think that permission denied be more appropriate than bad request then.
The message should just say that the user isn't allowed to make this call. I agree that we don't want to reveal that internal actors exist.
replies.author: handavid

replies.bodyText: We're not exposing this to customers (they won't have an option to set an accountId through public api). They might somehow figure out how to call this endpoint without going through the public api but we don't need to give friendly message in this case. The message as it is right now is more useful to internal developers.
replies.author: aarman-cloudera

replies.bodyText: I agree that it should be Permission Denied.  I would prefer to have the same exception message as thrown by the Scrutinizer (see validateActorCrnInAccountOrInternal). You can put any other information you think is useful in a log message.
replies.author: giladwolff
